Short description: Simple Student's t and Wilcox tests are used to assess differences between groups
A Negative Binomial (NB) generalized linear model is used to describe the counts
Test: Empirical Bayes + moderated t, robust estimation of priors (if robust = TRUE), with or without weights (generated by weights_ZINB)
Suggested input: raw counts with edgeR normalization factors

Short description: A Linear model of the log2-transformed CPMs with weights is used to describe differences between groups
Test: Empirical Bayes + moderated t, with or without weights (generated by weights_ZINB)
Suggested input: raw counts with edgeR normalization factors

Short description: A Negative Binomial (NB) generalized linear model is used to describe the counts
Test: Empirical Bayes + LRT, with or without weights (generated by weights_ZINB)
Suggested input: raw counts with DESeq2 size factors

Short description: A non-parametric approach for the comparison of tag-wise statistics and a noise distribution to detect differential abundance
Test: M and D statistics compared with the noise distribution
Suggested input: raw counts or normalized/transformed counts setting norm = "n"

Short description: A variance component score test accounting for data heteroscedasticity through precision weights is used to assess differences between groups
Normalization/Transformation: automatically transforms raw counts into log(CPM) if preprocessed = FALSE
Suggested input: raw counts or log transformed counts setting preprocessed = TRUE

Short description: Zero-Inflated Gaussian (ZIG) mixture model or Zero-Inflated Log-Gaussian (ZILG) mixture model are used to describe the counts
Suggested input: raw counts with CSS normalization factors

Short description: A Beta-Binomial regression model is used to descrive the relative counts
Test: test = 'LRT', 'Wald' with (if boot = TRUE) or without bootstrap
Normalization/Transformation: Automatically transforms raw counts into relative abundances (like using TSS)

Short description: Compositional approach - Monte-Carlo sampling from a Dirichlet distribution to estimate the real relative abundances and CLR-like transformation to assess differences between groups
Normalization/Transformation: denom = 'all', 'iqlr', 'zero', 'lvha', 'median', or decided by the user. With test = 'glm', denom = 'all'

Short description: Compositional approach - Analysis of microbiome compositions with or without "sampling fraction" bias correction
Test: ANCOM-II ANOVA models for log-ratios (if BC = FALSE) or linear model with offsets for log-counts (if BC = TRUE)
Normalization/Transformation: Automatic in-method transformation and zero types imputation
Output: p-values and statistics if BC = TRUE, only statistics otherwise

Short description: A test is performed on transformed, normalized, and/or scaled data to assess differences between groups
Normalization/Transformation: norm = 'LogNormalize', 'CLR', 'RC', 'none' (with test = 'negbinom', 'poisson', or 'DESeq2', data are not transformed). scale.factor parameter to scale data

Short description: A Truncated Gaussian hurdle model is used to describe the counts
